cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error
import numpy as np

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Fill missing values
train.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)
test.fillna(method='ffill', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_cols = ['MSZoning', 'Street', 'LotShape', 'LandContour', 'Utilities', 'LotConfig', 'LandSlope', 'Neighborhood', 'Condition1', 'Condition2', 'BldgType', 'HouseStyle', 'RoofStyle', 'RoofMatl', 'Exterior1st', 'Exterior2nd', 'MasVnrType', 'ExterQual', 'ExterCond', 'Foundation', 'BsmtQual', 'BsmtCond', 'BsmtExposure', 'BsmtFinType1', 'BsmtFinType2', 'Heating', 'CentralAir', 'Electrical', 'GarageType', 'GarageFinish', 'PavedDrive', 'Fence', 'MiscFeature']
train[categorical_cols] = train[categorical_cols].astype('category').apply(lambda x: x.cat.codes)
test[categorical_cols] = test[categorical_cols].astype('category').apply(lambda x: x.cat.codes)

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
y_train = train['SalePrice']

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
test_scaled = scaler.transform(test.drop(columns=['Id']))

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
X_val = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv').drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val)
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Calculate RMSE
rmse = np.sqrt(mean_squared_error(y_val, y_pred))
print(f'Validation RMSE: {rmse}')

# Predict on test set
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test['Id'], 'SalePrice': model.predict(test_scaled)})
submission.to_
